Further, has anyone been able to use NEAT within MRDS?

--- In neat@yahoogr=
oups.com, "erikcss" <erikcss@...> wrote:
>
> Some explanation and backgroun=
d before my question... setting the 
> stage if you will:
> 
> I have been =
developing a robot for quite some years now and while 
> doing this have be=
en looking for a suitable neural network engine 
to 
> drive some of the co=
gnitive functions. 
> 
> Years back, I learned that the standard neural net=
work methodology 
> will not work because of the need of a training set. Go=
od luck 
> creating a training set for a mobile robot. So, I developed a fe=
w 
> methods to emulate a training set, effectively evolve the network 
> d=
ynamically. But, this had several obvious deficiencies. I soon 
found 
> NE=
AT, rtNEAT, and hyperNEAT. 
> 
> From what I understand after reading sever=
al publications and 
> experimenting with some established demonstrations, =
I found the the 
> NEAT model is quite useful, but also presents several ob=
stacles of 
> its own. In a physical robot, evolving networks is not very 
=
> practical. So, after some careful consideration, I came up with a 
> solu=
tion.
> 
> The solution was to have two environments. One drives the robot =

with 
> a basic hyperNEAT neural network, while a second environment runs =

in 
> a simulated environment. The NEAT in the simulation will be allowed =

> to evolve until a threshold is met for a Fitness improvement. When 
> th=
is threshold is achieved, that neural network is transitioned to 
> the liv=
e robot, and the simulation is given fresh environment data 
> from the sen=
sors, and the cycle begins again. This will allow the 
> NEAT to evolve, an=
d still allow for good operation of the robot. 
> 
> A lot of this is going=
 to be done in MRDS to minimise computation 
in 
> the robot, and also take=
 advantage of the physics and other 
> components of the simulation environ=
ment.
> 
> This is the model I am going to try to implement, which then lea=
ds 
me 
> to my question.
> 
> Question 1:
> I have been able to find quite=
 a bit of documentation on the 
various 
> forms of NEAT. But, I have been =
able to find no information on how 
to 
> actually use NEAT in code. Perhap=
s I am not looking in the right 
> places. Hopefully you can point me in th=
e right direction. 
> 
> Question 2:
> Has anybody done any work along this=
 line? I see many projects that 
> use NEAT for various organism simulation=
s and such, but not really 
> anything to drive a physical robot. I would a=
ppreciate any help on 
> this.
>
